verses.kjv: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.
verses.ct: Joseph was taken down to Egypt, where Potiphar purchased him from the Ishmeelites who had brought him there. Potiphar was an Egyptian official of Pharaoh and the captain of the guard.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
verses.ct: The LORD was with Joseph, and he became a successful man while living in the household of his Egyptian master.

verses.kjv: And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
verses.ct: His master noticed that the LORD was with Joseph and that the LORD caused everything Joseph did to succeed.

verses.kjv: And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
verses.ct: Joseph earned Potiphar's trust and became his personal attendant. Potiphar put him in charge of his entire household and entrusted everything he owned to Joseph's care.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
verses.ct: From the moment Potiphar put Joseph in charge of his household and all his possessions, the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house because of Joseph. The LORD's blessing was on everything Potiphar had, both inside the house and out in the fields.

verses.kjv: And he left all that he had in Joseph’s hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.
verses.ct: So Potiphar left everything in Joseph's care and didn't concern himself with anything except the food he ate. Now Joseph was well-built and handsome.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
verses.ct: After some time, Potiphar's wife began looking at Joseph with desire. She said, "Sleep with me."

verses.kjv: But he refused, and said unto his master’s wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
verses.ct: But he refused and told his master's wife, "Look, my master doesn't worry about anything in this house because he has placed everything he owns under my responsibility.

verses.kjv: There is none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
verses.ct: No one in this household has more authority than I do. He has withheld nothing from me except you, because you are his wife. How could I possibly do something so wicked and sin against God?"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
verses.ct: She pressured Joseph day after day, but he refused to sleep with her or even spend time alone with her.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
verses.ct: One day, Joseph went into the house to take care of his work, and none of the household servants were inside.

verses.kjv: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
verses.ct: She grabbed him by his clothing and said, "Sleep with me!" But he pulled away, leaving his clothing in her hand, and ran outside.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
verses.ct: When she realized he had left his clothing in her hand and had run out of the house,

verses.kjv: That she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
verses.ct: she called out to her household servants and said to them, "Look at this! My husband brought this Hebrew into our home to humiliate us! He came to me trying to sleep with me, but I screamed as loud as I could.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
verses.ct: When he heard me raise my voice and scream, he left his clothing next to me and ran out of the house."

verses.kjv: And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
verses.ct: She kept Joseph's clothing beside her until her husband came home.

verses.kjv: And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
verses.ct: Then she told him the same story: "That Hebrew slave you brought into our home came to me to humiliate me.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
verses.ct: But when I raised my voice and screamed, he left his clothing beside me and ran outside."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
verses.ct: When Potiphar heard his wife's account — "This is what your slave did to me" — he became furious.

verses.kjv: And Joseph’s master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king’s prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
verses.ct: Potiphar had Joseph arrested and thrown into the prison where the king's prisoners were held. So Joseph remained there in the prison.

verses.kjv: But the LORD was with Joseph, and shewed him mercy, and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
verses.ct: But the LORD was with Joseph and showed him mercy, causing the prison warden to look on him with favor.

verses.kjv: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph’s hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
verses.ct: The warden put Joseph in charge of all the prisoners in the facility, and Joseph managed everything that happened there.

verses.kjv: The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
verses.ct: The warden didn't need to oversee anything under Joseph's care, because the LORD was with him and made everything he did succeed.
